messages: 59038bee05182ebbbfc5e6933d8acb18 (02:00): ok...I got 2.6.15 installed with Sarge finally...now what do I need to get for X 3d using a ATI radeon video card?

c48e8be015a05f50c5163d6ab0d634dc (02:01): customized

9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:04): Azar: that sounds like you need some fan(s) to make it cooler for them, because over 40 C. is pretty hard (especially for HD's)..

5fe72667d76d0f68d46390d03c940350 (02:05): sgeigerbot: e100 works in most places where eepro100 did
9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:06): Azar: a nice feature in gkrellm is to just shutdown the box after a special temp. in gkrellm, via sudo its pretty trivial to shut down the box then..

c48e8be015a05f50c5163d6ab0d634dc (02:07): sandman, no

6f7075f5fe41cf71800763e9d5256271 (02:08): abrotman: I was going on faith that it worked with this machine.

0efe2b90deb00e1c60a865c6a2df9958 (02:08): Try http://kmuto.jp/debian/hcl/ to find out which driver supports your device.
1609d51876d7982b59be3a9751bf10a9 (02:08): i keep getting /usr/sbin/mkinitrd: /dev/loop/0: Unknown root device
9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:08): Azar: most of them are packaged
6a31b59008793e32477357d5464ec772 (02:09): streuner: I am running sarge with 2.6.8 kernel for now with a simple base gkrellm
e9cdf813725156a80fef04356070e184 (02:09): streuner, anything I could put there so that the mouse wheel works properly, as it doesn when starting X through startx ?

3031a30d605c83f1a3d59d8e6061957b (02:09): I'm looking for a program that can be used to configure a kiosk for networking (dhcp/ppp/pppoe), and doesn't require X, preferably something that runs on a local web server.
1609d51876d7982b59be3a9751bf10a9 (02:09): and i can't seem to get any relevant info on the subject
9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:09): veleno: that has nothing to do with startx or gdm
6a31b59008793e32477357d5464ec772 (02:09): streuner: I do not seem to find anything related to system temperature monitor on mine
e9cdf813725156a80fef04356070e184 (02:10): streuner, ok. so what has something to do with it ?
9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:10): Azar: those values are supported by lm-sensors, just get a newer package then...
9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:10): veleno: abrotman told you before, scroll up.
c2c8c35a9e4e1c990f66bc41aa5fe2c2 (02:10): USmarine: So what's wrong with the line?
6a31b59008793e32477357d5464ec772 (02:10): streuner: reinstall gkrellm, or install lm_sensors?
5fe72667d76d0f68d46390d03c940350 (02:11): oh .. i asked which mouse protocol you were using
9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:11): Azar: its a lm-sensors issue, they develope very hard and support newer chipset better in newer packages...
e9cdf813725156a80fef04356070e184 (02:11): oh. i see. so imps protocol works fine when running through startx, and not throug gdm ?
c48e8be015a05f50c5163d6ab0d634dc (02:11): sandman, something like this /dev/hda6       none            swap    sw              0       0
9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:12): ImPS/2 is the protocol you need in order to support the mouse-wheel
9bb2470d3c1f08a35ebb6a00ab4f51a1 (02:12): you can change it via dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xfree86(xorg)
